{"step_by_step_thinking": "Palpable purpura is a condition where purpura, which constitutes visible non-blanching hemorrhages, are raised and able to be touched or felt upon palpation. HSP may appear after a remote history of infection (often an upper respiratory tract infection) as a rash with palpable petechiae or purpura.
